question_title: Which Party will win the 2026 Gorton and Denton by-election?
summary: The Gorton and Denton by-election (Feb 26, 2026) is a three-way race between Greens, Reform UK, and Labour. Betting markets strongly favor the Green Party (~50% implied from Betfair 1.88 odds), with Reform second (~33% at 3.0) and Labour third (~16% at 6.4). Labour damaged their chances by blocking popular Andy Burnham from standing, combined with historic national unpopularity. In a three-way race, the Greens benefit from vote splitting between Labour and Reform. Some polls show Reform leading in raw vote share (30%), but the Greens' strong local organization and momentum in betting markets make them the frontrunner.

factors.description: Betting market consensus: Betfair Exchange has Greens at 1.88 (~53%), multiple bookmakers have them odds-on favorites. Markets have moved from Reform-favored to Green-favored.
Labour blocked Andy Burnham from candidacy: Major self-inflicted wound removing their strongest local candidate. Generally seen as reason for their collapse in this race.
Vote splitting dynamics: In a three-way race, Greens can win with ~30% if Labour and Reform split the remaining vote. Benefits the candidate with most motivated base.
Labour's national unpopularity: Below 20% nationally, Starmer at historic personal unpopularity. Lost recent by-elections including Runcorn & Helsby to Reform.
Some polls show Reform leading in raw vote share (30% vs Labour 27%, Greens 17%), suggesting betting markets may be over-weighting Green ground game.
Reform's high-profile candidate Matt Goodwin (commentator/former academic) has media presence and Manchester family roots, but betting markets still favor Greens.
